page.title: 08GEDLING BOROUGH COUNCIL
page.content: In Arnot Hill Park is a big house, built for Hawksley the owner of a textile mill,built in the park.After several changes of owners,it was used as a hospital in 1918.In 1921 Arnold Borough Council(now Gedling)bought it for their new Council Offices.At present,at a cost of 1600000 pounds, the new Council offices are being built.Now the house is surrounded by a variety of trees,with an ornamental pond with a lot of wild fowl and a fountain.The park contains a Fire Station and the road works depot.Also there are a war memorial,swings,pond,a lodge and an aviary.There is also the remains of a railway,converted to a path along a little cutting.The head gardener sleeps in a room in the house when he wishes,as a guard.
